Package src.recomanador.domini

Class ConjuntRecomanacions

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
java.util.AbstractList<E>
java.util.ArrayList<Recomanacio>
src.recomanador.domini.ConjuntRecomanacions
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Recomanacio>, Collection<Recomanacio>, List<Recomanacio>, RandomAccess
public class ConjuntRecomanacions extends ArrayList<Recomanacio>
This class describes a set of recommendations as an extenssion of ArrayList of recommendations. It always has the array sorted by item id and user id to improve efficency on certain calls.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ConjuntRecomanacions

      public ConjuntRecomanacions()
      Constructs a new empty instance.

    • ConjuntRecomanacions

      public ConjuntRecomanacions(ConjuntItems ci, ConjuntUsuaris cu, ArrayList<ArrayList<String>> raw) throws src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemNotFoundException, src.recomanador.excepcions.UserNotFoundException, src.recomanador.excepcions.DataNotValidException
      Constructs a new instance with the recommendations and ratings from the raw data obtained from the ratings file. It also sets the correct elements in the sets of recommendations and ratings of the users. It sorts the elements by item id.
      Parameters:
      ci - Set of items from the Domain Controler
      cu - Set of users from the Domain Controler
      raw - The raw data from the ratings file
      Throws:
      src.recomanador.excepcions.ItemNotFoundException - Thrown if a item was not found.
      src.recomanador.excepcions.UserNotFoundException - Thrown if a user was not found.
      src.recomanador.excepcions.DataNotValidException - If some value is not correct(ratings,...)

    • cercaBinaria

      private int cercaBinaria(int item_id, int usuari_id)
      Returns de index of the element with item id = item_id and user id = user_id, or if it doesn't exist, the position where it should be added. It uses a binary search.
      Parameters:
      item_id - The item identifier
      usuari_id - The user identifier
      Returns:
      The index where the user should be
